trans-unit.source: Add multiple tasks to a job
trans-unit.target: Add multiple tasks to a job

trans-unit.source: Requests to add multiple tasks to an account in the Batch service support the following concepts:
trans-unit.target: Requests to add multiple tasks to an account in the Batch service support the following concepts:

trans-unit.source: Each request must contain a unique Content-ID MIME part header.
trans-unit.target: Each request must contain a unique Content-ID MIME part header.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned with the result of the operation in the response, and can be used to match an individual request with its response.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned with the result of the operation in the response, and can be used to match an individual request with its response.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service returns a HTTP Status Code 400 (Bad Request) if any request contains an invalid set of headers or contains operations which are not supported in the batch.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service returns a HTTP Status Code 400 (Bad Request) if any request contains an invalid set of headers or contains operations which are not supported in the batch.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service returns a HTTP Status Code 202 (Accepted) for a valid request.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service returns a HTTP Status Code 202 (Accepted) for a valid request.

trans-unit.source: The server will then stream the results of individual operations.
trans-unit.target: The server will then stream the results of individual operations.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service can re-order the responses of these requests.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service can re-order the responses of these requests.

trans-unit.source: The Content-Id MIME part header need to be used by the Client to match the request corresponding to the response.
trans-unit.target: The Content-Id MIME part header need to be used by the Client to match the request corresponding to the response.

trans-unit.source: The response contains the results and error information for each operation.
trans-unit.target: The response contains the results and error information for each operation.

trans-unit.source: If the server times out or the connection is closed during the request, the request may have been partially or fully processed, or not at all.
trans-unit.target: If the server times out or the connection is closed during the request, the request may have been partially or fully processed, or not at all.

trans-unit.source: In such cases, the user should re-issue the request.
trans-unit.target: In such cases, the user should re-issue the request.

trans-unit.source: Note that it is up to the users to correctly deal with failures when re-issuing a request.
trans-unit.target: Note that it is up to the users to correctly deal with failures when re-issuing a request.

trans-unit.source: For example, the users should use the same task ids during retry, so that if the prior operation succeeded, the retry will not create extra tasks unexpectedly.
trans-unit.target: For example, the users should use the same task ids during retry, so that if the prior operation succeeded, the retry will not create extra tasks unexpectedly.

trans-unit.source: A request can include at most 100 operations.
trans-unit.target: A request can include at most 100 operations.

trans-unit.source: All the tasks in this request must belong to the same job.
trans-unit.target: All the tasks in this request must belong to the same job.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a request containing three tasks to be added under a job.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a request containing three tasks to be added under a job.
